title: 107_hr3920
content: The "Rancher Preservation Act" may require special provisions for the conservation of the black-tailed prairie dog under the Endangered Species Act of 1973. The Secretary must use the best scientific and commercial data available to determine the status of the black-tailed prairie dog as an endangered or threatened species. This includes giving weight to empirical or peer-reviewed data and field observations. Data from landowners regarding the species' status must be accepted and acknowledged. The status of the black-tailed prairie dog is determined using the best scientific and commercial data available, including data from landowners. Independent scientific review requirements define actions and qualified individuals as those with expertise in biological sciences. Qualified individuals for independent scientific review in the biological sciences must demonstrate expertise on the black-tailed prairie dog or similar species, have no conflicts of interest, not be involved in related petitions or determinations, and have no financial interests opposing the action under consideration. The Secretary appoints 3 qualified individuals from a list of independent scientific reviewers to review and report on the scientific information and analyses for proposed actions. Reviewers are compensated for their work and must provide their opinion within 3 months. Their selection and activities are not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The Secretary appoints 3 independent scientific reviewers to evaluate scientific information for proposed actions on the black-tailed prairie dog. Reviewers must provide their opinion within 3 months. The final determination includes a summary of the review results and an explanation if recommendations are not followed. The peer review report is made public for review before the comment period closes. The comment period on the proposed action is open. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections in the Act. Special requirements for black-tailed prairie dog are specified in Section 13.
